title: Tlaquepaque Arts District
description: Step into a world of color, craftsmanship, and tradition. Tlaquepaque is a charming neighborhood filled with artisan galleries, colonial streets, and vibrant plazas. It’s the perfect place to shop for handmade ceramics, enjoy live mariachi, and experience the artistic spirit of Guadalajara.

title: Instituto Cultural Cabañas
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this neoclassical building houses powerful murals by José Clemente Orozco and rotating exhibitions of contemporary art. It’s a cultural landmark that bridges Mexico’s past and present through visual storytelling.

title: Zapopan Basilica
description: Located in the neighboring city of Zapopan, this stunning basilica is a pilgrimage site and architectural gem. Its baroque façade and peaceful gardens make it a serene escape from the urban buzz — and a testament to Jalisco’s spiritual heritage.
